verses.kjv: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
verses.web: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
verses.ct: Remind the believers to submit to their rulers and authorities, to obey those in charge, and to be ready to do whatever is good.

verses.kjv: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
verses.web: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.
verses.ct: They should never slander anyone. They shouldn't be quarrelsome but gentle, showing true humility to everyone they meet.

verses.kjv: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
verses.web: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
verses.ct: After all, we ourselves used to be foolish, disobedient, and easily deceived. We were slaves to all kinds of desires and pleasures. We spent our lives drowning in bitterness and envy — despised by others and despising each other.

verses.kjv: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
verses.web: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,
verses.ct: But then the kindness and love of God our Savior broke through into the world.

verses.kjv: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
verses.web: not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,
verses.ct: He saved us — not because of any righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He did it through the washing of rebirth and the renewal that comes from the Holy Spirit,

verses.kjv: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
verses.web: whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;
verses.ct: which he poured out on us generously through Jesus Christ our Savior.

verses.kjv: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.web: that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.ct: He did this so that, having been made right with God by his grace, we could become heirs with the hope of eternal life.

verses.kjv: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
verses.web: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;
verses.ct: This is a trustworthy saying. I want you to insist on these things confidently, so that everyone who believes in God will be devoted to doing good. These things are both good and beneficial for everyone.

verses.kjv: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
verses.web: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
verses.ct: But stay away from pointless debates, arguments about genealogies, and fights over the law. They accomplish nothing and are a complete waste of time.

verses.kjv: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
verses.web: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning,
verses.ct: If someone keeps stirring up division, warn them once, then warn them a second time. After that, have nothing more to do with them.

verses.kjv: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
verses.web: knowing that such a one is perverted and sins, being self-condemned.
verses.ct: You can be sure that a person like that has become twisted and keeps on sinning — they've condemned themselves by their own actions.

verses.kjv: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
verses.web: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.
verses.ct: Once I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come meet me in Nicopolis, because I've decided to spend the winter there.

verses.kjv: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
verses.web: Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.
verses.ct: Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey. Make sure they have everything they need.

verses.kjv: And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
verses.web: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
verses.ct: Our people need to learn to devote themselves to doing good and meeting urgent needs, so that their lives aren't unfruitful.

verses.kjv: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.web: All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.ct: Everyone here with me sends their greetings. Give our greetings to those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
